page.title: 02Houses
page.content: Our block has many varieties of buildings. Many houses are made of the brick that is made in Bellingdon. There are also many flint cottages in the country areas. In Chesham you would see mostly small Victorian style buildings. Roofs are now usually slated although some houses have thick tiles instead. The oldest buildings are the churches but the oldest house is in Church Street and dates from 1642. The area with the most modern houses is on the Hivings Estate to the north-east of our block. These areas are mostly council houses although some of have been bought and done up.Some houses have cellars. Some walls are pebbledashed and some are tiled. There are no elaborate chimneys but our speciality is gateways.We have an average of 11 rooms per house and most of us have garages.
